meanings.definition: A person who believes that nothing is known or can be known of the existence or nature of God.
meanings.sent1: Many agnostics prefer to focus on what can be observed rather than what cannot.
meanings.sent2: The agnostics in the group had differing opinions on spirituality.
meanings.sent3: The agnostics at the debate club meeting joked about having a 'mystery' theme for their next event.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an agnostics' library, full of unanswered questions.
meanings.sent5: The agnostics' uncertainty about the divine made them seekers of truth.

meanings.definition: A person who is unsure or noncommittal about the existence of God.
meanings.sent1: The agnostics in the class were open to exploring different beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She considered herself an agnostics, not firmly believing in any specific religion.
meanings.sent3: The agnostics at the party playfully debated whether the cake was a gift from a higher power.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts on faith were as wavering as an agnostics' stance on theology.
meanings.sent5: The agnostics' indecision about God left them in a state of contemplation.
